input_text:
Job Title: Practice Administrator

Location: Nashville Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Management

Description:
Join our team and succeed with us!
About EPPEndodontic Practice Partners (EPP) is a nationwide partnership of private endodontic practices focused on patient care, clinical quality, and nationwide growth. We empower our practices to keep their individuality and achieve their goals by providing expert business resources and support to achieve their vision. We prioritize relationships and trusted connections that are necessary for an endodontic business to grow and prosper, especially in today’s competitive and evolving healthcare landscape. Endodontic Practice Partners is built on integrity, quality, compassion, and putting the patient first.
Position SummaryOur M City Endodontics practices located in the Nashville, TN metropolitan area (Brentwood, Smyrna) are searching for seasoned dental Practice Administrators. The Practice Administrator serves as the business partner to the Endodontist(s) and is responsible for overseeing operations within a dental practice setting. This includes staff management, OSHA/HIPAA compliance, superior patient care and practice business management. This is a management role that requires leadership experience, a strong business acumen as well as effective communication, organizational and accounting skills.
Duties and ResponsibilitiesOversee day-to-day operations, ensuring the practice runs efficiently and adheres to industry standards and regulations.Lead, mentor, and support a team of dental professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, continuous learning, and exceptional patient care and experience.Manage office supplies, budgets, invoices and IT equipment.Manage the financial aspects of the practice, including billing, budgeting, and forecasting, to ensure profitability and sustainability. Adept at utilizing metrics to guide business decisions and optimize practice operations.Effectively manages accounts receivable to ensure monthly goals are met, keeping AR > 90 days at 10% or less.Ensure a high standard of patient care by liaising with the team, addressing patient concerns, and implementing feedback-driven improvements.Oversee hiring processes, ensure continuous professional development for the team, and foster a culture of excellence and growth.Keep abreast of the latest technology, trends, and best practices in dental health management to drive innovation and excellence in the practice.Closely monitor the practice schedule to ensure optimal productivity.Manage referral marketing and internal marketing initiatives. Build and maintain strong relationships with referring providers, identify areas of opportunity and partner with support coordinator to ensure needs are met. The expectation is that 4 days per month are dedicated to marketing efforts.Oversee processing of insurance claims and eligibility verification, including audits to ensure accuracy.Posting of insurance payments, including processing appropriate adjustments and refunds.Assure EOD reports are complete with accuracy and are balanced.Ensure compliance with company policies and proceduresThe PA role is an exempt position. The work schedule is determined by the office hours of operations and may fluctuate. This position is a 40-hour work week.
Supervisory ResponsibilitiesManage practice team in partnership with owner doctors.Provide continuous performance management and oversee the annual performance review process.Prepare staff schedule to align with doctor’s schedule and business volume.Review and approval of employees paid time off and payroll.Handle employee relations issues.
Required Skills / AbilitiesProficient in the use of Microsoft Office productsWorking knowledge with dental procedures, terminology, and dental insurance submissionExcellent customer service skillsStrong leadership skills with a high level of professionalismGood written and oral communication skillsSelf-motived with strong time management and multi-tasking skills
Education and ExperienceBachelors degree in business administration or related field is preferredMinimum of three (3) to five (5) years of dental office management experience; and/or equivalent education and/or experience is required
Physical RequirementsProlonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computerMust be able to lift-up to 15 pounds at timesVisual acuity to read records and documents
We value our employees! We offer fantastic benefits, such as:Health InsuranceLife InsuranceDental InsuranceVision InsuranceDisability insuranceFlexible Spending accountHealth Savings accountPaid time offPaid holidays401(k) w/ matchingEmployee Discount ProgramEmployee Assistance Program
Endodontic Practice Partners LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Practice Administrator
output_json.summary: Seasoned dental Practice Administrator needed for M City Endodontics practices in the Nashville, TN area.
preferred_degrees: Bachelors degree in business administration or related field
job_responsibilities: Manage office supplies, budgets, invoices, and IT equipment
Manage financial aspects of the practice
Ensure high standard of patient care
Stay updated on technology and trends
Process insurance claims and eligibility verification

output_json.company_information: EPPEndodontic Practice Partners (EPP) is a nationwide partnership of private endodontic practices focused on patient care, clinical quality, and nationwide growth.
